Title: How to Lose Friends & Alienate People
Author: Peter Straughan

Replies.Reply: A YOUNG BOY sits watching the film, his clothes and the room around him telling us this is England in the 1960s. He is staring raptly at the actress.

On the building across the street is an ENORMOUS ANIMATED BILLBOARD L'OREAL ADVERTISEMENT - SOPHIE MAES, in a gold ball-gown and make-up, hair coiffured in classic forties Hollywood style. As we watch she BLOWS US A KISS.
All my life I've been a Looky-
My life didn't used to be like this.
Looky-Loos. That's what They call you when you stand out in the rain all night just to catch a glimpse of Them going by.
How many pigs are coming tonight?

The Looky-Loos dream is that one day they will somehow get to mingle with the stars. But the Industry can't allow any mingling. Stars have to be kept away from civilians, have to be quarantined, so they don't become normal. Like us.
But after the awards come the parties - the Miramax Party, the London Records Party and, best of all - the Sharps Magazine Party, so exclusive that there are no pass-alongs, no plus-ones, no press.
How much? I only want to stay for one night!
And that is when I strike.
I want you in bed by ten. And no porn.
You can do this. You belong here.
No, when I'm in L.A. I stay at the Sunset Marquis, when I'm here I always stay at the Sanderson.
Oh, I'm a writer. Movie writer.
Yeah. Got one in pre-production now. You know it's really weird running into you like this because just the other day I was telling the producer I thought you'd be perfect for the lead.
Couldn't one of you answer the phone?
Will you answer that? What do I pay you for?
George can't leave. You'll have to apologise.
We're not scared of you, Harding.
Hi, my name's Clark. Clark Baxter.
Is he? He's fucking small isn't he?
I'm a journalist. Work for a little periodical you might have heard of called Sharps Magazine?
Who's that there with Clint Eastwood?
It's okay. It's okay. I've got it.
It's pronounced Gloucester by the way.
Do you think I could have his drink?
Guess who that is with Clint Eastwood.
Was it? Fuck. I mean, shit.
You can do this! You can do this!
Quick coffee Bob and then you've got to go.
You like it? I brought you one.
Good. Thanks for the business class tickets, Clay.
Oh. Well, if it's any consolation I got downgraded anyway.
You photograph famous people when they're drunk?
Okay. What do you mean by suitable?
this funny looking kid? Is that his son?
Listen, seeing as how I'm going to be sitting just over there, don't you think we should try and put last night behind us?
Actually it's Sidney. Sidney Young. Clark Baxter is my alias.
I take it you knew about Bob and didn't tell me?
Hello, is that the Parsons Gallery?

This is Sidney Young from Sharps Magazine? We're running some photographs from your opening of the Chris Blick exhibition, and I just need to caption them. I was wondering if you could help me identify some of the people?
Is Chris Blick a man or woman?
Are you sure you're calling from Sharps magazine?
Tell me Stanley, why have they given you this assignment if you don't know who one of the most famous artists in America is?
Okay. Is he an old man?
Okay, I've got two old men here -
What's that got to do with anything?
Is he the one with the wonky eye?
It's fashion sensitive. If you're not wearing Prada it'll take your arm clean off.
I don't know. The Algonquin circle. Dorothy Parker. Martinis.
There's something you should understand. I'm not really one of you.
I mean the glossy posse. Bunch of Zombies, writing about "Pets of the Stars" but acting like they're working for the UN. I'm here to shake things up a bit.
could only dream of getting out.
That was her? The Mussolini baby?
Am I supposed to be afraid?
I don't know the meaning of the word fear.

When Clayton left college he started this little magazine called Snipe. Fantastic. Took aim at every self-important celebrity in town. Completely fearless. It was like my magazine but twenty years earlier.
That's why he's hired me. I am the young Clayton Harding. He looks at me and sees his glory days.
Yeah, but don't worry. I think I might still be in time to save him.
You've reached Sidney Young. I'm sorry but my answering machine is out of order, so the voice you are hearing is actually me.
There's a couple of hundred grands worth of food here and I swear I'm the only person eating it. You want some?
This place is amazing. It's wall to wall totty.
Look at that. All night people have been treating us like we're royalty. In London, the journalist's motto is "Everybody hates us and we don't care."
I shouldn't be here. I get thrown out of places like this.
Excuse me? Aren't you Rachel Petkoff? Rachel turns to look at him.
Uhuh, Con Air. It's got everything. Malkovich for your acting chops, Nicky Cage for action, Buscemi for comedy, John Cusack for the Gays. It's a smorgasbord.
I won't eat anything with, you know, eyebrows.
Or if it can chuckle. I won't eat animals that can chuckle.
Yeah, I could tell by the way he was allowed to stay up past his bed time.
Do you think she'd go out with me?
Sophie Maes. You think she'll go out with me?
What do you know? A lot of these starlets are lonely. They spend their time looking for a man.
Have you seen this? She's everywhere.
I try and track her down and, you know, "Who is the elusive Paris Hilton and why is she so publicity shy?"
Listen, you know how things work around here. How am I going to get something in the magazine?
I know he's got a head start on me but I'm going to win her back.
Guess who that is with Clint Eastwood?
Great to meet you Nathan. I'm a big fan. I love that rat thing you played in The Lion King.
Which is fine, but today, I think it would be great to get behind the mask.
Absolutely. Of course. So, first question - are you Jewish?
Okay. Next question. The rat thing - that's gotta be Disney's first gay animal, right? So, I was wondering - are you a homosexual?
The Queen? Yeah, I know the Queen. Just fill in the form will you?
It was my mother's. She gave it to me.

We're gonna be best pals aren't we? You're going to like me more than that prick Maddox, aren't you? Fetch!
I was just trying to make friends. Please don't tell her.

I want to do a story on Vincent Lepak. Not a puff-piece.

Well, can I at least check that she got my present?

Just a couple of straws please.
Can I ask you something? How come you've always got the notebook?
What's he do, the mystery guy? Is he a hack too?
Just most poets you see aren't really good-looking, are they?
I resent being bribed to gush sycophantically about a star, okay? I choose to gush sycophantically.
It's okay anyway. Clayton's given me a story. I'm on my way.
advice, you'll get yourself a boyfriend who's going to show up once in a while.
Did you read my story on Vincent Lepak?

Uh, Lawrence? This lady's been looking for you?
I didn't know it was Take Our Daughters To Work Day. I didn't even know there was a Take Our daughters To Work Day.
I don't know - why did you hire me?
What was wrong with my story?
Why did you kill my Vincent Lepak story?
"A free press is the last defence against the Tyranny of Stupidity."
It isn't mine. It's yours. First issue of Snipe.
Won't you have to run a decision like that past Eleanor first?
Looks like I was too late to save you after all.
I didn't "hire" him. Bob did it for a favour.
is, he kind of took over.
Clayton's not going to print anything I write. I've been on salary for six-months and I've written precisely one hundred and seventy five words. On a dollar-
Everybody hates me here. You're the only one who'll talk to me.

Congratulations on becoming incredibly famous by the way.
Wizard! Wizard Dentist Man! Need Wizard Dentist Man!
I will never, never, never forget this. Thank you!
You can't drive. You need to go and sleep this off somewhere.
Yeah, okay. Listen, you try driving in this state you're gonna kill yourself.
I didn't know you hated me.
You're not a Ghoul. You're a Zombie.
Look, I don't need to hear this.
Shut up will you? You'll wake the old witch up.
She, uh, she isn't actually a prostitute.
I think you should lie down Alison.
You should have said you were coming.
Why've you always got to do this?
More? Sharps is one of the most respected magazines in the world.
You know who I interviewed recently? Nathan Lane.
I KNOW you don't know who that is! You don't know who anyone is!
Things haven't really been that great. I don't know what it is.
No. I'm fine. I know I can make it.
She doesn't feel that way about me. New York women don't date losers.
No, she died when I was young.
Yeah, I suppose. I used to see her on the TV every now and then when I was growing up. Sort of weird.
I do. Can I read the rest of it?
"Keep true to the dreams of thy youth."
I was just walking past this music shop on the corner and I saw it. I thought it might cheer you up.
come here to listen to it.

You get full copy approval. It'll be like you've written it!

I've got my little limpy dance.
This is me at the Golden Globes.
She isn't the One. My mother gave me that ring and told me I had to give it to the One. She isn't the One.
We are CLOSE on an extremely handsome YOUNG MAN staring past us with a dazzling smile.
Babe was a cute little piglet.
No, you can't leave him with me.
We are looking OVER THE SHOULDER of a tall grey-haired MAN who stands in the shadows watching Sidney run past. This is CLAYTON HARDING, his face hidden for the time being.
Look, we don't hate celebrities at the Post-Modern Review, okay?
You know what I read the other day? Your collection of poems -
Sidney, if she doesn't apologise I'm quitting.
This is Clayton Harding. I'm the editor of Sharps Magazine.
I saw you at my party, just before you ruined it with your little pig stunt.
I especially liked the part where Clint Eastwood beat the shit outa ya.
I want you to come and work for me at Sharps Magazine in New York.
What the fuck are you wearing?
Next time you come here dressed like that, you follow the shirt.
Sit down. How was the flight?
That was a mistake. And don't call me Clay.
There are seven rooms in all.
Which brings us to the subject of your sense of humour. I had a look through your "magazine"
I'm going to try you out in the I Spy Section.
If I give you an interview will ya leave me the fuck alone?
What did I say to you?
What did I say to you?
What did I say to you?

Did they find that rat yet?
I don't know. Thousand dollars a plate, all I could taste was ass.
Look at these things. How'd I get a closet full of blue fucking shirts?
I don't know either. This is an office for Christ's sake! Why've I even got a fucking closet?
Fuck it. Yeah. Do it. He's an annoying little prick. Go take him down. This is your shot.
Sounds good. Let's do it. Okay that's it people.
Oh, and for those who haven't heard, Alison is going to be running the I Spy section from now on as Lawrence here has just gone up in the world. He is replacing Greg Roberts as Deputy Editor.
I had an attack of nostalgia.
It wasn't good enough. Plain and simple.
We don't do hatchet jobs here.
I'm trying to run a fucking magazine here!
Save me your tin-pot philosophy, okay?
Oh, grow the fuck up, will ya!
Lawrence Maddox is no longer working for Sharps. Seems Elizabeth got sick of him screwing around and kicked him out.
Richard Heywood doesn't seem to like the idea of employing an ex-

Don't worry about Maddox. He's already lined up something with Gotham Magazine. I'm gonna need someone to hold the fort at I Spy. Strictly on a temporary basis, you understand? One more thing. Eleanor Johnson rang this morning, wondering if you'd like to write a profile on Vincent Lepak.
I don't know how you did it but somehow you've made it into the next room.
I'm Sophie Maes' assistant. I'm afraid Sophie isn't here right now.
Okay. Did you send the flowers?
Yeah. It was kinda shocking. Were they dead when you sent them?
This magazine you are working for? It is good?
It was a pleasure to meet you Lord Young.
I'm sorry, my boyfriend's sitting there.
That's his White Russian. He'll be here in a second.
Just doing my bit for the gene pool.
Are you going to get off that seat?
Do you know the meaning of Karma?
You want a seat? I'm just leaving.
I hear the Cultural Editor's job is up for grabs?
Okay. Which way did you come in?
He uses it when he's trying to pick up transsexuals.
Not that it's any of your business, but I'm from Port Huron, Michigan.
Are you insane? That was Lawrence's wife, Elizabeth! Her father owns Sharps!
No! Listen to me - you do NOT approach Elizabeth Maddox, you do NOT talk to her! Don't even make eye-contact with her? Do you understand?
I'm sure there are many words you don't know the meaning of!

His glory days? Sharps has won fourteen National Magazine awards and increased its advertising pages by more than 60 percent since he took over. He's paid millions of dollars a year. He lives in a Bank Street townhouse, and weekends in the Hamptons.
Sidney was just marvelling at the abundance of "Totty" here.

For your information he wasn't pawing her! He was just doing his job! In case you haven't noticed Sharps has to have a star on the cover every month. And most of those stars are clients of Eleanor's. So do not piss her off.
No. Girls like Sophie don't date journalists. As far as she's concerned, you're the help.
I thought all this "fluff" was beneath you?
My God, you're like a serial killer.
You don't need my help to screw up here, Sidney. I mean, the only things you make are mistakes and stains.
You know what I don't understand?
I thought you wanted to be a success here?
The famous alter-ego? How long's he been hanging around?
my life so, you know, I'm gonna get drunk.

I've got to go. Got to go.
Need a cigarette. Where are my fucking cigarettes?
Do you think I have low self-
I'm so fucking sophisticated! I mean there's not even a little bit of Port Huron left, right?
OH GOD! I'M A WHORE! I'M A WHORE!

Replies.Reply: He's doing just great at the magazine.
But I think that was pretty much an act. So, Mister Sidney, whatcha doing here?
A book! Hey - I'm writing a book.

Okay. Better go before I find out something else I don't know about Sidney.
Must have been pretty cool having your mom in the movies.
I don't know. I don't even know if I'm going to bother finishing it.
I'll jump in the shower and then I really will get out of your hair.
Are you kidding? I could throw up on you again.
Not at all. Why, she's so thin I could just take her little spindly body and snap it over my knee like a dry fucking twig.
Oh, and for your information Sidney Young has got more going for him than most of the men in this town.
That's why I don't go there any more.
What? I can't understand what you're saying.

I just wanted to say I heard about you getting the promotion.
I'm gonna powder my nose. Why don't you put on something a little more romantic?
I don't think we've been introduced?
Are you Lawrence Maddox? The new deputy editor?
Well, I've just come to say congratulations on your promotion.
Well, Sidney. We've only just met but already I perceive I am in the presence of a rare comic sensibility.

I know your Hi-jinx gave you a certain notoriety back in Olde England but things are going to be a bit different here. Harding wants me to be your Rabbi, show you the ropes. Are you aware of what we do at I Spy?
This isn't a vacation. It's a vocation.
When we do go out you're going to have to wear something more suitable.
Something that covers all of this up.
No, Sidney, that's Richard Heywood. The owner of this magazine.
That's his daughter, Elizabeth; now my wife.
Miss Olsen here takes care of the gallery openings, book launches and other intellectual fare. Can you find our new rookie something to do?
Well, now you're one of the High Priests of what's Hot and what's Not. So what were you two talking about?
Uh-oh. I don't think Miss Olsen approves of you, Sidney.
It's a rat fuck, isn't it?
I'd have to disagree with you, Vincent.
You're making movies that are worthwhile.
Mister Young, this is Eleanor Johnson, Queen of New York.
Oh, this one will go far.
We're going on to the Circle Club. I'll see you tomorrow.
I'm from Canada, land of ice and snow.
Sorry, you're not on the list.
"Thanks for a great night." What a sweet kid. Oh, Sidney, about last night - word of advice.
Well, I'm one of the Friends Of Cuba.
So how's it feel to be a star?
Of course you can. He can stay in my office. Sidney? Fetch Cuba a bowl of water, will you?

Yeah. Rachel Petkoff, fabulous sixties actress, one of my all time favourites. Just made a wonderful movie called Five Boroughs. I think she's poised for a come-back and I think we should get there first, do a profile.
So it was. You have any more good ideas don't forget to bring them to my new office.
By the way, there've been complaints about you skulking around the water-cooler, trying to talk to women. It's inappropriate behaviour.
When I do it it's called flirting. When you do it it's called sexual harassment.
I know that wasn't Greg's way of working but Greg isn't deputy editor any more. I am, and I'm making changes.
Sophie, my darling. Looking ravishing as always.
Well, well, if it isn't Sidalee.

So Alison told you we were getting together right?
Yeah. Should have done it long ago but, you know me - just not very good at expressing my emotions. Right?

And will you stop carrying that thing around with you? It's kind of embarrassing.
Made it all the way to the Seventh Room.
Congratulations. The wheel of fortune right? You go up, I go down. You're here with Sophie?
Alison? No, we went our separate ways. Actually she left me. Tells me she's in love with someone else.
Nope, not you I'm afraid Sidalee.
Why do you have an alias?
By the way, post-shoot clear out.
Oh he's down the hall. Room 217.
Honey, everyone needs to change their look every now and then.
Well, that English guy is always hanging around you these days, right?
Oh don't be crazy! Alice? Is Anna fat?

These are gorgeous, but I'm just too fat.
wonderful writer. I really felt like he got to the heart of me.

here with Sophie Maes, I want you to meet her. New film, The Suffragette coming out, the buzz is A-mazing. The release is tied in with the roll-out of the Reebok campaign, and now Louis Vuitton's on the line. This train is leaving the station Lawrence.

nominated we want Sharps to do a feature. Someone to cover the whole lead up, unrestricted access, the trajectory, the building of this unique brand.

What are you doing? Let her go!

Which reminds me, I was talking to a publisher friend of mine the other day. He mentioned that they were planning a series of introductory texts on philosophers. I wondered if you would be interested?

I saw the way you looked at her.
